required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Immunogenicity of Two Doses of aH5N1 Vaccine in Adult and Elderly Subjects With and Without Underlying Medical Conditions
clinical_study.official_title: Phase III, Stratified, Randomized, Controlled, Observer-Blind, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of Two Doses of aH5N1 When Administered to Adult and Elderly Subjects With and Without Underlying Medical Conditions.

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the safety, immune response and reactogenicity of aH5N1 vaccination in adult (18 through 60 years of age) and elderly (≥61 years of age) subjects with and without underlying medical conditions.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.description: Seroconversion is defined as hemagglutination inhibition (HI) ≥1:40 for subjects who were seronegative at baseline [day 1 HI titer <1:10] or a minimum 4-fold increase in HI titer for subjects who were seropositive at baseline [day 1 HI titer ≥1:10])

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric mean ratios (GMRs) as determined by HI assay
Percentage of subjects with an HI titer ≥1:40

primary_outcome.description: In pooled age groups 18 years of age and older subjects who are healthy or with underlying medical condition who have received aTIV or aH5N1 vaccine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric mean titers (GMTs) as determined by HI
secondary_outcome.description: HI assay: homologous antibody responses to aH5N1 vaccine 3 weeks after first vaccination (day 22) according to CHMP immunogenicity criteria in adult and elderly subjects who are healthy or with underlying medical condition

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric mean ratios (GMRs) as determined by SRH
Percentage of subjects with an HI titer ≥1:40

secondary_outcome.description: Seroconversion is defined as SRH area ≥25 mm2 for subjects who were seronegative at baseline [day 1 SRH area ≤3.997 mm2] or a significant increase [at least 50% increase] in SRH area for subjects who were seropositive at baseline [SRH area >3.997 mm2])

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with geometric mean area ≥25 mm2

secondary_outcome.description: Seroconversion is defined as HI ≥1:40 for subjects who were seronegative at baseline [day 1 HI titer <1:10] or a minimum 4-fold increase in HI titer for subjects who were seropositive at baseline [day 1 HI titer ≥1:10])

secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 43 (3 weeks after the second vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: Serial radial haemolysis (SRH) assay: homologous antibody responses to aH5N1 vaccine 3 weeks after first and second vaccinations (day 22 and day 43) according to CHMP immunogenicity criteria in adult and elderly subjects who are healthy or with underlying medical condition

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric mean titers (GMTs) as determined by HI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 43 (3 weeks after the second vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: HI assay: homologous antibody responses to aH5N1 vaccine 3 weeks after first vaccination (day 22) according to CHMP immunogenicity criteria in adult and elderly subjects who are healthy or with underlying medical condition

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric mean titers (GMTs) as determined by HI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 22 (3 weeks after the first vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: HI assay: homologous antibody responses to aH5N1 vaccine 3 weeks after first vaccination (day 22) according to CHMP immunogenicity criteria in adult and elderly subjects who are healthy or with underlying medical condition

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with an HI titer ≥1:40
Percentage of subjects with geometric mean area ≥25 mm2
Percentage of subjects with geometric mean area ≥25 mm2

secondary_outcome.description: Seroconversion is defined as SRH area ≥25 mm2 for subjects who were seronegative at baseline [day 1 SRH area ≤3.997 mm2] or a significant increase [at least 50% increase] in SRH area for subjects who were seropositive at baseline [SRH area >3.997 mm2])

Serial radial haemolysis (SRH) assay: homologous antibody responses to aH5N1 vaccine 3 weeks after first and second vaccinations (day 22 and day 43) according to CHMP immunogenicity criteria in adult and elderly subjects who are healthy or with underlying medical condition

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric mean ratios (GMRs) as determined by SRH
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 43 (3 weeks after the second vaccination)

reference.citation: Atmar RL, Keitel WA, Patel SM, Katz JM, She D, El Sahly H, Pompey J, Cate TR, Couch RB. Safety and immunogenicity of nonadjuvanted and MF59-adjuvanted influenza A/H9N2 vaccine preparations. Clin Infect Dis. 2006 Nov 1;43(9):1135-42. Epub 2006 Sep 25.

Banzhoff A, Gasparini R, Laghi-Pasini F, Staniscia T, Durando P, Montomoli E, Capecchi P, di Giovanni P, Sticchi L, Gentile C, Hilbert A, Brauer V, Tilman S, Podda A. MF59-adjuvanted H5N1 vaccine induces immunologic memory and heterotypic antibody responses in non-elderly and elderly adults. PLoS ONE. 2009;4(2):e4384. Epub 2009 Feb 6.
Podda A. The adjuvanted influenza vaccines with novel adjuvants: experience with the MF59-adjuvanted vaccine. Vaccine. 2001 Mar 21;19(17-19):2673-80. PubMed PMID: 11257408.
